skillTree.name: Skeletal Steed
skillTree.description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

skillTree.name: Tomb Barque
skillTree.description: Bone-ribbed war barques sail majestically above the sands of Nehekhara in mockery of the laws of nature.

skillTree.name: Ceremonial Bandages
skillTree.description: Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.

skillTree.name: Trapped Soul
skillTree.description: Souls retrieved from the Netherwold and bound to their controller provide a degree of magical resistance.

skillTree.name: Elixir of Immortality
skillTree.description: This complex distillation not only preserves the drinker in glorious Unlife, it also increases their physical resistance to attack.

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Knowledgeable
skillTree.description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve: -8

skillTree.name: Incantation of Preservation
skillTree.description: When intoned, this ritual text holds back decay so the Tomb Kings' souls can be bound to their mortal remains once more.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide

skillTree.name: Keeper of Lore
skillTree.description: There are specialised rituals, chants and incantations for drawing forth dead spirits and binding them back into their corporeal forms; this one knows them all.

skillTree.name: Mortuary Cultist
skillTree.description: Knowing your way around the Realm of Souls, along with knowledge of the required ritual incantations, are essential skills for the dedicated Liche Priest.

ui_effects.description: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops
➕ Summons a larger unit of Skeleton Warriors
➕ Activates automatically when conditions are met
➕ Fires 5 projectiles each dealing 0 300 damage and 100 100 explosion damage (2m)
➕ Fires 5 projectiles each dealing 0 300 damage and 100 100 explosion damage (2m)
➕ Fires 5 projectiles each dealing 0 300 damage and 100 100 explosion damage (2m)
➕ Fires 5 projectiles each dealing 0 300 damage and 100 100 explosion damage (2m)

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Shem's Burning Gaze"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shem's Burning Gaze Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Shem's Burning Gaze Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Pha's Protection"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Pha's Protection Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Pha's Protection Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Light of Battle"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Light of Battle Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Light of Battle Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Net of Amyntok"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Net of Amyntok Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Net of Amyntok Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Banishment Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Birona's Timewarp"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Birona's Timewarp Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -10% for "Birona's Timewarp Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for all spells

ui_effects.description: ➕ Improves power recharge rate by 1 every 7 seconds
➕ Fires 5 projectiles each dealing 0 300 damage and 100 100 explosion damage (2m)

skillTree.name: High Priest
skillTree.description: It is an honor indeed to be joined in battle by one of such distinction.

skillTree.name: Ornamented Headdress
skillTree.description: Far from a symbol of vanity, the priest's headdress can strengthen their connection to the winds.

skillTree.name: Runic Staff
skillTree.description: Not only a token of his office, the staff's runic inscriptions empower and protect the priest.

skillTree.name: Incantations of Preservation
skillTree.description: Though typically performed in the necropolis, lesser incantations can be performed on the battlefield.

skillTree.name: Winds of Time
skillTree.description: Sometimes it's possible to bend time.

skillTree.name: Magic Stability
skillTree.description: Only few casters are able to stabilize winds of magic.

skillTree.name: Vicious Curses
skillTree.description: To fall to a Lich Priest's curse is to suffer and serve his whims for eternity.

effects.description: Missile strength: +5% for Casket of Souls units
Ammunition: +10% for Screaming Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

skillTree.name: Power Sap
skillTree.description: Drain the winds of magic before the enemy can turn them against us.

effects.description: Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve: -5

skillTree.name: Experienced
skillTree.description: Practiced in the art of casting; always with a spell at the ready.

skillTree.name: Calming
skillTree.description: Your life is balanced on the edge of a knife when drawing from the winds. Too swift, and the winds will claim your life. Too slow, and the enemy will.

skillTree.name: Quell
skillTree.description: He who casts the first spell draws first blood.

effects.description: Enemy Winds of Magic starting amount: -1
Enemy Winds of Magic starting amount: -3
Enemy Winds of Magic starting amount: -6

skillTree.name: Onslaught
skillTree.description: With the right amount of preparation, the winds can be harnessed to empower even the soldier’s mundane weapons.

skillTree.name: Potent
skillTree.description: So great is this one’s raw power that the winds gust in unison.

skillTree.name: Replenish Troops
skillTree.description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 7%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 12%

skillTree.name: Dark Knowledge
skillTree.description: Nagash left many secrets to discover.

skillTree.name: Damage Building
skillTree.description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.name: Wound
skillTree.description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 4% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 10% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 18% chance of wounding target

skillTree.name: Hinder Replenishment
skillTree.description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.name: Specialist
skillTree.description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

skillTree.name: Canopic Jar Hoarder
skillTree.description: These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.

skillTree.name: Maintenance
skillTree.description: FACTIONWIDE: all source of income: -1%. Effect is additive. Negated on level 30 of character.

skillTree.name: Aggressive
skillTree.description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.

skillTree.name: Fleet-Footed
skillTree.description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

skillTree.name: Strong
skillTree.description: Well built, robust. Powerful.

skillTree.name: Tough
skillTree.description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

skillTree.name: Cunning
skillTree.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

skillTree.name: Master of Ceremony
skillTree.description: "Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Years…"

skillTree.name: Treacherous
skillTree.description: The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
Melee defence: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units

skillTree.name: Wise
skillTree.description: Benevolent Tahoth imparts sacred knowledge and timeless wisdom to his people.

skillTree.name: Wrathful
skillTree.description: The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.

skillTree.name: Eternal
skillTree.description: Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.

skillTree.name: Proficient Caster
skillTree.description: There are many perfectly-uttered litanies and precise incantations required to draw forth spirits from the Realm of Souls. This one knows them all.

skillTree.name: Channeller
skillTree.description: This Liche Priest is so powerful he can tap energy directly from the Realm of Souls and direct it at will.
